p: The distribution of the identified major VOCs in the profiles of C. amada and C. longa accessions was investigated by performing the PCA loading plot. Among the annotated VOCs some were highlighted in the PCA loading plot as representative compounds that contributed to the separation of the two species, i.e., C. amada and C. longa ( Figure 1b). In C. amada samples, the compounds such as β-myrcene [ID071], o-cymol [ID089], 1,8-cineole [ID099], camphor [ID152], γ-curcumene [ID275], cuparene [ID276], α-zingiberene [ID280], β-sesquiphellandrene [ID289], ar-turmerone [ID349], and ( E)-γ-atlantone [ID357] were detected at relatively high level ( Figure 1b, Table S1). The VOCs like β-elemene [ID247], α-funebrene [ID250], α-santalene [ID257], trans-α-bergamotene [ID260], teresantalol [ID261], α-santalol [ID270], and β-bisabolene [ID283] were found in abundance in C. longa sample ( Figure 1b). The result was consistent with significant differences between these species as shown in Supplementary Table S1.
